reference_pointers.pl_string: Triazole and its derivatives have a broad range of biological and pharmacological properties, such as anti-bacterial, anti-human immunodeficiency virus2, anti-microbial3, anti-fungal4, anti-viral5, and anti-cancer effects6–14. For example, Abdou et al. designed and synthesised the triazole structure of amino-thiadiazole/thiadiazide-phosphate esters and studied the anti-cancer characteristics on 10 cancer cell lines7. Although triazole derivatives can inhibit the proliferation of several cell types, their anti-cancer mechanism of action remains unclear.

Although triazole derivatives can inhibit the proliferation of several cell types, their anti-cancer mechanism of action remains unclear.
